newsitem.title: BRAZIL: Rainfall patchy in key Brazil soybean areas - Somar.
newsitem.headline: Rainfall patchy in key Brazil soybean areas - Somar.

text.p: Rainfall will be concentrated in the southeast and centre-west of Brazil's key soybean growing regions this week with the north receiving relatively little rain, independent meteorologist Somar said.
Heavy clouds and showers prevailed over the centre-east of Brazil where a summer weather system caused heavy rains last week, especially in Londrina, Cascavel and Passo Fundo.
"This restored moisture conditions to normal," Somar said.

Rains and occasional thunderstorms were set to continue in the southeast and centre-west of the soybean regions this week, but showers will be isolated and weak in the north of Rio Grande do Sul, Santa Catarina and Parana.
This followed a week of scarce rains and rising temperatures in Rio Grande do Sul and Santa Catarina, Somar said.
The weather service also predicted that cold fronts this week would have little impact in the south.
Rainfall in December and the historical monthly average in key states in millimeters were as follows:
STATE TOTAL RAIN TOTAL RAIN AVERAGE
-- Joelle Diderich, Rio de Janeiro Newsroom +55 21 507 4151
